description.narrative: The Project Development Objectives (PDO) are to restore, improve, and enhance resilience of public services, environmental facilities, and livelihoods in Targeted Communities, and to enhance the capacity of state entities to respond promptly and effectively toan eligible crisis or emergency.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :CER Component | Description :The PIE jointly with India to: (a) determine the occurrence of an eligible crisisor emergency; (b) prepare a component-specific operations manual; (c) identify, strengthen and maintain a coordination authoritycapable of carrying out the activities and responsibilities set forth in the operations manual; and (d) prepare and disclose anyrequired safeguard document. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS
Finance Agreement :Complaints Mechanism | Description :The PIE to establish and/or strengthen, maintain and operate a grievanceredress mechanism at all levels. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Contractors’ Safeguard Obligations | Description :The PIE to include compliance with the Safeguard Documents aspart of the contractors’ obligations pursuant to the bidding documents. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Government Permits-Compensation/Relocation Assistance | Description :The PIE to ensure that prior to commencingany civil works: (a) all governmental permits and clearances have been obtained and pre-constructions conditions imposed have beenmet; and (b) all resettlement compensation and relocation assistance has been paid/provided. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Units-II | Description :The PIE to maintain (a) a SSC for policy guidance and general oversight;and (b) a PMU within the APRDMD for coordinating the day-to-day financial management and reporting under the Project, carrying outthe activities under component 5, monitoring and evaluating the PIUs implementation of other Components, and ensuring compliancewith safeguard documents and the handling of Project grievances. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementation Units-III | Description :The PIE to hire a senior finance officer or chartered accountant withskills, qualifications, experience and terms of reference satisfactory to the Association. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Implementing Units -I | Description :PIE to establish, and thereafter maintain, 6 PIUs within EPDCL, PRD, R&BD,GVMC, VUDA, and APFD with adequate resources, to carry out day to day Project activities including cost estimates, procurement andbids related documentation and reports, contracts, government clearances and permits, financial management under their respectiveComponents ensuring enforcement/compliance with safeguard docs. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Ineligible Expenditures | Description :The PIE to pay any land acquisition, and any compensation, resettlementand rehabilitation payments out of its own resources. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Management Information System | Description :PIE to maintain a management information system in form andsubstance satisfactory to the Association, which system shall be updated/expanded in a manner and substance agreed with theAssociation. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Operations Manual | Description :The PIE to prepare and adopt and Operations Manual as agreed with theAssociation, and thereafter, implement the Project in accordance with such manual. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Procurement documentation and record keeping system | Description :The PIE to maintain a fully operationalprocurement documentation and record keeping system, in a manner and substance agreed with the Association, including a freely andpublicly accessible database with an interface (link) with APRDMD’s and the Line Departmentsand Agencies’ websites. | Frequency:CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Resilient Electrical Network | Description :PIE to enter into a written agreement with EPDCL under terms andconditions agreed with the Association to comply with all the fiduciary and safeguard standards, procedures and requirements. |Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Restoration of Environmental Services and Facilities and Livelihood Support | Description :PIE to (i) determineif assistance of one or more Participating Agencies is necessary in the implementation of Component 4; (ii) identify, through APFD,such Participating Agency in a manner agreed with the Association (iii) enter into a written agreement with such ParticipatingAgency under terms and conditions agreed with the Association to comply with all the fiduciary and safeguard standards. | Frequency:CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Safeguard Documents | Description :The PIE to carry out, and cause each of the Line Departments and Agencies tocarry out, the Project in accordance with the ESMF, and the EMP(s), RAP(s), and/or IPDP(s) (the Safeguard Documents). | Frequency:CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Safeguard Reporting & Monitoring | Description :The PIE to: (i) maintain monitoring and evaluation protocols andrecord keeping procedures to supervise and assess compliance with Safeguard Documents; and (ii) report on quarterly basis oncompliance with Safeguard Documents. | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :Screening of Activities - Social & Environmental Documents | Description :The PIE to (a) screen (through thePMU/PIUs) any proposed activities as per the ESMF and, whenever required, prepare the necessary EMP(s), RAP(s) and/or IPDP(s); and(b) publicly disclose those safeguards documents, including an executive summary in local language(s) at the relevant project’ssites. | Frequency :CONTINUOUS

Finance Agreement :Third Party Quality Consulting Firm(s) | Description :The PIE to select and hire the services of (a) third partyquality consulting firm(s) to carry out quarterly quality monitoring and reporting to the PMU on contract performance andcompliance with and/or implementation of the statutory/regulatory requirements, safeguards documents and Operations Manual. |Frequency :CONTINUOUS

title.narrative: Number of people with access to restored and improved rural roads and shelters
Distribution lines (LT) constructed or rehabilitated under the project
Number of electric consumer accounts covered by the underground cable network
Number of saplings raised in the nurseries
Design guidelines for buildings and public infrastructure updated
Zero million has been allocated to CERC. Shall only be activated in response to Govt request as result of an emergency
Communication and search and rescue equipment provided to the state disaster response force
Preparatory work for Beachfront improvement and restoration completed
Procurement and design for RK Beach restoration complete
PMU established and adequately staffed by experts drawn from each of line departments
Number of workdays generated to provide improved livelihood support
Integrated Emergency Management Solution is established and operational
Number of systems in place to enhance State's capacity to manage disasters
Length of roadside Avenue plantation of native cyclone resistant species
Designs for Eco Park and Zoo completed
State Disaster Management Authority is equipped with Geo-Spatial Laboratory for GIS mapping and analysis of emergency situations
